poem:
### Lines Beneath the Baltic

Under the sea's cold gaze,  
wires once whispered secrets,  
now cut like silent tongues.  
A murmur of sabotage  
drifts through waves,  
where nations stitch blame  
across watery borders.  
In the deep,  
the dark chorus broods,  
wondering whose hands  
held the quiet scissors.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "We assume damage to Baltic Sea cables was sabotage, German minister says Germany has said it has to assume that damage to two undersea fibre-optic communication cables in the Baltic Sea since Sunday was an act of sabotage. Two cables in the Baltic – one between Finland and Germany, the other between Sweden and Lithuania – were severed on Sunday and Monday, raising suspicions of a malicious attack, though authorities initially declined to speculate. “No". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
